googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Massachusetts driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Massachusetts driver’s license number or the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you have neither, write “NONE” in the box.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an absentee ballot application in the mail.
* Any registered Massachusetts voter request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Secretary of the Commonwealth  
Elections Division, Room 1705  
One Ashburton Place  
Boston, MA 02108
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Most Massachusetts voters do not need to show ID.  First time Massachusetts voters should plan on showing ID at the polls. Acceptable forms of photo ID include: a driver license from any state, a US passport, a government ID card, a military ID card, a tribal ID card, or a student ID card from an accredited college or university.  Acceptable forms of non-photo ID include a recent utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows your name and Massachusetts address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges:
* Due to COVID-19, Massachusetts will not require an excuse to vote by mail for 2020 elections.
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7:
You may register with a party. Members of political parties may vote only in their own party's primary elections. 
Voters who choose not to enroll in a party and members of political designations or minor parties may vote in the party primary of their choice.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Massachusetts driver's license or state ID card.  If not, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Massachusetts voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Massachusetts you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Massachusetts
  * be 18 years old on or before the next election
  * not have been convicted of corrupt practices in respect to elections
  * not be under guardianship with respect to voting
  * not be currently incarcerated for a felony conviction
